properties.name: scroll-timeline-name
properties.computedValue: the keyword none or a list of CSS identifiers

properties.name: scroll-timeline-axis
properties.computedValue: a list of the keywords specified

values.name: block
values.prose: Specifies to use the measure of progress along the block axis of the scroll container. (Default.)

values.name: inline
values.prose: Specifies to use the measure of progress along the inline axis of the scroll container.

values.name: x
values.prose: Specifies to use the measure of progress along the horizontal axis of the scroll container.

values.name: y
values.prose: Specifies to use the measure of progress along the vertical axis of the scroll container.

values.name: nearest
values.prose: Specifies to use the nearest ancestor scroll container. (Default.)

values.name: root
values.prose: Specifies to use the document viewport as the scroll container.

values.name: self
values.prose: Specifies to use the element’s own principal box as the scroll container. If the principal box is not a scroll container, then the scroll progress timeline is inactive.

properties.name: view-timeline-name
properties.computedValue: the keyword none or a list of CSS identifiers

properties.name: view-timeline-axis
properties.computedValue: a list of the keywords specified

values.name: block
values.prose: Specifies to use the measure of progress along the block axis of the scroll container. (Default.)

values.name: inline
values.prose: Specifies to use the measure of progress along the inline axis of the scroll container.

values.name: x
values.prose: Specifies to use the measure of progress along the horizontal axis of the scroll container.

values.name: y
values.prose: Specifies to use the measure of progress along the vertical axis of the scroll container.

values.name: nearest
values.prose: Specifies to use the nearest ancestor scroll container. (Default.)

values.name: root
values.prose: Specifies to use the document viewport as the scroll container.

values.name: self
values.prose: Specifies to use the element’s own principal box as the scroll container. If the principal box is not a scroll container, then the scroll progress timeline is inactive.

properties.name: view-timeline-inset
properties.percentages: relative to the corresponding dimension of the relevant scrollport
properties.computedValue: a list consisting of two-value pairs representing the start and end insets each as either the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

values.name: auto
values.prose: Indicates to use the value of scroll-padding.

values.name: <length-percentage>
values.prose: Like scroll-padding, defines an inward offset from the corresponding edge of the scrollport.

properties.name: animation-range-start
properties.percentages: relative to the specified named timeline range if one was specified, else to the entire timeline
properties.computedValue: list, each item either the keyword normal or a timeline range and progress percentage

values.name: normal
values.prose: The start of the animation’s attachment range is the start of its associated timeline; the start of the animation’s active interval is determined as normal.

values.name: <length-percentage>
values.prose: The animation attachment range starts at the specified point on the timeline measuring from the start of the timeline.

values.name: <timeline-range-name> <length-percentage>?
values.prose: The animation attachment range starts at the specified point on the timeline measuring from the start of the specified named timeline range. If the <length-percentage> is omitted, it defaults to 0%.

properties.name: animation-range-end
properties.percentages: relative to the specified named timeline range if one was specified, else to the entire timeline
properties.computedValue: list, each item either the keyword normal or a timeline range and progress percentage

values.name: normal
values.prose: The end of the animation’s attachment range is the end of its associated timeline; the end of the animation’s active interval is determined as normal.

values.name: <length-percentage>
values.prose: The animation attachment range ends at the specified point on the timeline measuring from the start of the timeline.

values.name: <timeline-range-name> <length-percentage>?
values.prose: The animation attachment range ends at the specified point on the timeline measuring from the start of the specified named timeline range. If the <length-percentage> is omitted, it defaults to 100%.

properties.name: timeline-scope
properties.computedValue: the keyword none or a list of CSS identifiers

values.name: none
values.prose: No changes in timeline name scope.

values.name: <dashed-ident>
values.prose: Declares the name of a matching named timeline defined by a descendant—​whose scope is not already explicitly declared by a descendant using timeline-scope—​to be in scope for this element and its descendants. If no such timeline exists, or if more than one such timeline exists, instead declares an inactive timeline with the specified name.

values.name: scroll()
values.prose: The scroll() functional notation can be used as a <single-animation-timeline> value in animation-timeline and specifies a scroll progress timeline. Its syntax is

values.name: block
values.prose: Specifies to use the measure of progress along the block axis of the scroll container. (Default.)

values.name: inline
values.prose: Specifies to use the measure of progress along the inline axis of the scroll container.

values.name: x
values.prose: Specifies to use the measure of progress along the horizontal axis of the scroll container.

values.name: y
values.prose: Specifies to use the measure of progress along the vertical axis of the scroll container.

values.name: nearest
values.prose: Specifies to use the nearest ancestor scroll container. (Default.)

values.name: root
values.prose: Specifies to use the document viewport as the scroll container.

values.name: self
values.prose: Specifies to use the element’s own principal box as the scroll container. If the principal box is not a scroll container, then the scroll progress timeline is inactive.

values.name: view()
values.prose: The view() functional notation can be used as a <single-animation-timeline> value in animation-timeline and specifies a view progress timeline in reference to the nearest ancestor scroll container. Its syntax is

values.name: <timeline-range-name>
values.prose: A named timeline range is a named segment of an animation timeline. The start of the segment is represented as 0% progress through the range; the end of the segment is represented as 100% progress through the range. Multiple named timeline ranges can be associated with a given timeline, and multiple such ranges can overlap. For example, the contain range of a view progress timeline overlaps with its cover range. Named timeline ranges are represented by the <timeline-range-name> value type, which indicates a CSS identifier representing one of the predefined named timeline ranges.

warnings.name: cover
warnings.prose: Represents the full range of the view progress timeline: 0% progress represents the latest position at which the start border edge of the element’s principal box coincides with the end edge of its view progress visibility range. 100% progress represents the earliest position at which the end border edge of the element’s principal box coincides with the start edge of its view progress visibility range.

warnings.name: contain
warnings.prose: Represents the range during which the principal box is either fully contained by, or fully covers, its view progress visibility range within the scrollport. 0% progress represents the earliest position at which either: the start border edge of the element’s principal box coincides with the start edge of its view progress visibility range. the end border edge of the element’s principal box coincides with the end edge of its view progress visibility range. 100% progress represents the latest position at which either: the start border edge of the element’s principal box coincides with the start edge of its view progress visibility range. the end border edge of the element’s principal box coincides with the end edge of its view progress visibility range.

warnings.name: entry
warnings.prose: Represents the range during which the principal box is entering the view progress visibility range. 0% is equivalent to 0% of the cover range. 100% is equivalent to 0% of the contain range.

warnings.name: exit
warnings.prose: Represents the range during which the principal box is exiting the view progress visibility range. 0% is equivalent to 100% of the contain range. 100% is equivalent to 100% of the cover range.

warnings.name: entry-crossing
warnings.prose: Represents the range during which the principal box crosses the end border edge 0% progress represents the latest position at which the start border edge of the element’s principal box coincides with the end edge of its view progress visibility range. 100% progress represents the earliest position at which the end border edge of the element’s principal box coincides with the end edge of its view progress visibility range.

warnings.name: exit-crossing
warnings.prose: Represents the range during which the principal box crosses the start border edge 0% progress represents the latest position at which the start border edge of the element’s principal box coincides with the start edge of its view progress visibility range. 100% progress represents the earliest position at which the end border edge of the element’s principal box coincides with the start edge of its view progress visibility range.
